cards.rules_text: Each player reveals their hand and library. Exile all enchantment cards, non-Human creature cards, and planeswalker cards from the battlefield, from graveyards, and from among the revealed cards. Each player shuffles, then draws a card for each card exiled from their hand this way.

Regression {3}{W}{W} [i](If you cast this for its regression cost, it has haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of your next upkeep and create a 1/1 copy of it with haste.)[/i]
When Unseen Hand enters the battlefield, destroy target nonland permanent an opponent controls with mana value less than or equal to Unseen Hand's power.

As Genomic Blueprint enters the battlefield, choose a nonland card name.
Triggered abilities of sources with the chosen name don't trigger.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Starlight seeks not only to control the population, but their every potential future.[/i]

cards.rules_text: arch of orazca, thran portal etc
Gain control of target land unless its controller sacrifices two creatures.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Rich in resources and strategically located amid shipping routes, Faleset was chosen as the ideal location for Starlight to build its underground complex. Its native populace were an inconvenience to overcome.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Black-Op Vanguard attacks a player or permanent, if no other creatures are attacking that player or permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on Black-Op Vanguard.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Far from the front lines, individual acts of state terror ensure the balance of power never tips against the Starlight agency.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Lone wolf [i](Whenever a creature you control attacks a player or permanent, if no other creatures are attacking that player or permanent, the creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Knowledge may be worth more than gold, but it can be stolen all the same.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Containment Unit enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Containment Unit leaves the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Containment is nine-tenths of the law on St. Cahand. The paranormal, evidence, knowledge, seditious thought—all trapped, confined, and locked away.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Into the Night enters the battlefield, target nonland permanent an opponent controls phases out until Into the Night leaves the battlefield. [i](Treat it and anything attached to it as though they don't exist until its controller's next turn.)[/i]
Exile target artifact, battle, or enchantment.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Commence bombardment. Civilians are their collateral, not ours.”
—Ben Grun, colonial agent[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying, double strike
Whenever a battle you control is defeated, put a +1/+1 counter on Assault Valkyrie.
Crew 2 [i](Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)[/i]

Prowess [i](Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]
Lone wolf [i](Whenever a creature you control attacks a player or permanent, if no other creatures are attacking that player or permanent, the creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]
Warped Amalgam can't be blocked as long as it's attacking a battle.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“What is life? Another tool to be pushed to its limits. A new world demands a new man, and we shall forge one.”
—Ben Grun, colonial agent[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Autonomous Bomber enters the battlefield, return target nonland permanent an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Piloted by a machine intelligence, flights over occupied territory come in two forms—bombing runs and scouting for bombing runs.[/i]

cards.card_name: CU12 Draw spell (two to three cards)

cards.rules_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses all abilities and is a blue Spirit creature with flying and base power and toughness 1/1. [i](It loses all other card types and creature types.)[/i]
Target artifact or creature's owner puts it on their choice of the top or bottom of their library. Surveil 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Those who cannot be dissuaded will be disappeared.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Draw X cards. If this spell was foretold, instead surveil 3, then draw X cards.
Foretell {X}{U} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Blue is listed as having 6 or 7 creatures and 7 or 8 noncreatures at uncommon. This slot will be either a creature or a noncreature.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
Interference Drone enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor_text: [i]As collapse neared with breakneck momentum, repression tightened accordingly. What could not be controlled could at least be observed.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Eager Conscript attacks a player or permanent, if no other creatures are attacking that player or permanent, Eager Conscript gains lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Plant hatred in the child early, and you will grow a yield of future killers.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Until end of turn, target creature gets -2/-2 and gains “At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice this creature unless you discard a card.”
cards.flavor_text: [i]Vast amounts of power are needed for Starlight's experiments, and the agency's disregard for its staff leaves little room for oversight.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Draw two cards. You lose 2 life unless a creature died under your control this turn.
Foretell {1}{B} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]
Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]As the rule of law broke down across St. Cahand, civilians began to echo the savagery of their governments.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Destroy target creature or planeswalker. If that permanent was tapped, surveil 2. [i](Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]
Foretell {1}{B} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]
Whenever you attack a player or permanent with exactly one creature, you gain 1 life and surveil 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Deny everything. Regardless of the evidence—deny everything.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Haste
Frenzied Slasher enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if it was foretold.
Foretell {R} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]
When Callous Observer enters the battlefield, exile the top card of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play that card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]They watch as a world burns around them, convinced that the flames will never reach them.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Trample
cards.flavor_text: [i]Starlight's rapidly-accelerating use of machine intelligence is a stark reminder of the agency's growing inhumanity.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Exile target artifact.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It takes dedicated action to prevent Starlight's assault on Faleset. Words are not enough at this stage.”
—Green Door, rogue agent[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Damage can't be prevented this turn.
Impending Collapse deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Unexplained phenomena began manifesting at the spot Entity X first arrived, but spread across the world along tracks dubbed ‘ley lines' by the superstitious.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
If this spell was foretold, it can't be countered and damage can't be prevented this turn.
Inevitable Depopulation deals X damage to each creature and planeswalker and to each battle you control.
Foretell {X}{R} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]

Crush the Weak deals 2 damage to each creature. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
Foretell {R} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]
Deathtouch
cards.flavor_text: [i]Even with multiple governments working in unison, Starlight cannot impose its will openly. It slows opposition to its plans with carefully cultivated obstacles, pysops and astroturfing dividing a captive populace.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
Foretell {G} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]The murder of Faleset's civilians was outsourced to experimental intelligences, often powered by supposedly innocuous tech companies.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Escaped Subject can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor_text: [i]In research labs hidden in nondescript buildings worldwide, Starlight agents push the limit of human subject research in the name of evolution.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Trample
cards.flavor_text: [i]Not content with the very real world being riven asunder in their hubris, Starlight cutouts in the tech industry have created vacuously artificial worlds to plunder.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control or target battle. If the creature you don't control would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.card_name: CG15 Dig for lands and/or creatures

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you cast a spell from anywhere other than your hand—
• If Embedded Agent is a Citizen, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes a Human Detective.
• If Embedded Agent is a Detective, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes a Human Advisor.
• If Embedded Agent is an Advisor, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.notes:
Green uncommon creature percentage have gone up slightly from 62% (8 out of 13) to 64% (9 out of 14), making it the only color, along with white, to go up in percentage.

...

Play Boosters have added 20 cards to uncommon. By default, five went to monocolor, ten to multicolor, and five to colorless, most often artifacts or lands. The uncommon creatures, like those at common, want to be generically useful. This is often where we'll put cards that have synergy with large set themes, allowing all colors access to it.

cards.rules_text: Desperate Patsy must be blocked if able.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“No loose ends. If you don't have an out—create one.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy target nonland permanent with mana value 3 or less.
cards.flavor_text: [i]As physics and stability decayed planewide, Project Starlight accelerated its plans to level civilizations for its underground safehouse, the Aleph complex.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy all creatures.
cards.flavor_text: [i]When Entity X breached the veil, Starlight scrambled to find a testbed for the contingencies it now needed. Faleset, a colonial holding long used for weapons testing, would be the lamb sacrificed at the agency's altar.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Green Door, Rogue Agent enters the battlefield, you may look at any number of face down cards on the battlefield or in exile.
Whenever Green Door attacks, exile up to one target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard. It becomes foretold. Its foretell cost is equal to its mana cost. [i](On a later turn, you may cast it for its foretell cost.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Unseen spies patrolled the skies over Faleset, ensuring no outside aid interrupted work on the Aleph complex.[/i]

Lone wolf [i](Whenever a creature you control attacks a player or permanent, if no other creatures are attacking that player or permanent, the creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]

Create three 1/1 white Advisor creature tokens with first strike and “This creature can't block.”
cards.flavor_text: [i]As reality degrades with increasing speed, Project Starlight operatives are deployed with increasing brutality.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to protect it. A creature attacking an Operation alone has menace.)[/i]
When Infiltrate the Archives enters the battlefield or is defeated, put a +1/+1 counter on a creature you control, then draw a card for each creature you control with a counter on it.

When Altered State enters the battlefield, exile up to one target instant or sorcery card from graveyard face down. It becomes foretold. The foretell cost is equal to its mana cost. [i](On a later turn, you may cast it for its foretell cost.)[/i]
Spells you cast from anywhere other than your hand cost either {U} or {R} [i](or {1})[/i] less to cast.

As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards. Create a 1/1 red Spirit creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]A single visitor showed St. Cahand it was not alone. For some, this existential threat required the harshest sanction.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, planeswalker, or battle, draw a card. Then discard a card unless no other creatures were attacking that player or permanent.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Every shot fired, every bomb dropped, is a data point to inform the next.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever Wetwork Specialist deals combat damage to a player or battle, draw a card.
Each battle you control enters the battlefield with one fewer defense counter on it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The only sign of her work is the sudden ending of passages of history.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Lifelink
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it wasn't cast from your hand, Captured Specimen deals 1 damage to each opponent.

Double strike
Whenever you cast a spell, Anomaly Extractor gets +1/+1 until end of turn. If that spell was cast from anywhere other than your hand, instead put a +1/+1 counter on Anomaly Extractor.

Whenever you attack a player or permanent with exactly one creature, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
• That creature gains double strike until end of turn.
Destroy target non-Advisor creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]An atmosphere of loathing settles over St. Cahand like smog, the air tense with a storm yet to break.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Asset Handler enters the battlefield, return target creature or battle card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Nonsense, dear boy. You saw no such thing. Now tell me all about it.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Trample
Whenever a battle enters the battlefield under your control or whenever a battle you control is defeated, put a +1/+1 counter on Stoic Agent.
cards.flavor_text: [i]He has seen things he can never see again, heard last words from men who officially never existed, lived a life he can never admit to.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

cards.flavor_text: [i]Entity X's arrival on St. Cahand caused a cascade effect, the power of the multiverse pouring into the plane for the first time.[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The world as we know it changing forever. But can we justify sacrificing a nation to save a meager few from the unknown?”
—Green Door, rogue agent[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. You may remove a defense counter from a battle you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Technological advances powered by the extranormal forces unleashed by Entity X's arrival have been used to push the boundaries of the Starlight agency's capabilities.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Mill four cards, then you may return a land card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Through this door is everything we've worked for—sanctuary and salvation. This is the end that justifies all means.”
—Ben Grun, colonial agent[/i]
[i]Colorless is listed as having 3 or 4 noncreatures and 2 or 3 lands at uncommon. This slot will be either a noncreature or a land.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
First strike
This creature can't block.

{W}{U} LONE WOLF Attack players and battles with solitary creatures to boost your success.
{U}{B} OPERATIONS These battles are fought in secret, with solitary attackers.
{B}{R} PARADOX Cast spells from anywhere other than your hand.
{R}{G} FORETELL Something strange and hidden is in the air. Lay your spells aside for later and revel in mystery.
{G}{W} LONE WOLF Your lonely attackers thrive in solitude with buffs and boosts.
{W}{B} ALONE Spread your attackers out—Operations and lone wolf triggers are your weapons.
{B}{G} OPERATIONS Outgrind your opponents with stealthy attackers and recursion.
{G}{U} OPERATIONS Your hardened agents adapt and overcome in the face of fresh battles.
{U}{R} FORETELL Hold a spell in secret like the threat of mass destruction, and out-bluff your foe.
{R}{W} NONCREATURES Civilians mean nothing to you. Forge victory by casting nnoncreature spells to succeed.

Menace
When Yuri Belyik, Astralnaut enters the battlefield, search your library for a battle or planeswalker card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text: [i]What returned was as changed as the world he left behind.[/i]
